```{.r .cell-code}
data_1 <- read.csv("C:/Users/ajfit/OneDrive/Documents/GBA 5910/Final Project/Data_Set_1.csv")
data_2 <- read.csv("C:/Users/ajfit/OneDrive/Documents/GBA 5910/Final Project/Data_Set_2.csv")
data_3 <- read.csv("C:/Users/ajfit/OneDrive/Documents/GBA 5910/Final Project/Data_Set_3.csv")

combined_data <- rbind(data_1, data_2, data_3)
```
:::



## Column - Plots

### Row - Top 10 States by count



::: {.cell title='1. Top 10 States by count'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Replace with your actual data frame name
df <- combined_data


top_states <- df %>%
  count(State, sort = TRUE) %>%
  top_n(10, n)

ggplot(top_states, aes(x = reorder(State, n), y = n)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "steelblue") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Top 10 States by Count",
       x = "State", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Row - Top 10 Counties by Count



::: {.cell title='2. Top 10 Counties by count'}

```{.r .cell-code}
top_counties <- df %>%
  count(County, sort = TRUE) %>%
  top_n(10, n)

ggplot(top_counties, aes(x = reorder(County, n), y = n)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "darkorange") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Top 10 Counties by Count",
       x = "County", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Row - Top 10 Cities by Count



::: {.cell title='3. Top 10 Cities by count'}

```{.r .cell-code}
top_cities <- df %>%
  count(City, sort = TRUE) %>%
  top_n(10, n)

ggplot(top_cities, aes(x = reorder(City, n), y = n)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "seagreen") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Top 10 Cities by Count",
       x = "City", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Column - Top State, County, and City Table



::: {.cell title='Top 10 State, County, and City Table'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load necessary library
library(dplyr)

# Get top 10 of each category
top_states <- df %>%
  count(State, sort = TRUE) %>%
  top_n(10, n) %>%
  arrange(desc(n)) %>%
  select(State)

top_counties <- df %>%
  count(County, sort = TRUE) %>%
  top_n(10, n) %>%
  arrange(desc(n)) %>%
  select(County)

top_cities <- df %>%
  count(City, sort = TRUE) %>%
  top_n(10, n) %>%
  arrange(desc(n)) %>%
  select(City)

# Create rank column
rank_labels <- c("First", "Second", "Third", "Fourth", "Fifth", 
                 "Sixth", "Seventh", "Eighth", "Ninth", "Tenth")

# Combine into one table
combined_table <- data.frame(
  Rank = rank_labels,
  State = top_states$State,
  County = top_counties$County,
  City = top_cities$City
)

# View the combined table
print(combined_table)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
      Rank State      County          City
1    First    CA Los Angeles       Houston
2   Second    TX      Harris     Charlotte
3    Third    FL      Dallas        Dallas
4   Fourth    SC Mecklenburg        Austin
5    Fifth    NC      Travis   Los Angeles
6    Sixth    NY      Orange       Raleigh
7  Seventh    PA  Montgomery     Nashville
8   Eighth    IL        Wake       Atlanta
9    Ninth    VA    Davidson Oklahoma City
10   Tenth    GA    Maricopa   Baton Rouge
```


:::
